message.content:
How to prevent seasonal allergies naturally: 

1. Monitor pollen levels and plan outdoor activities accordingly: Check your local weather forecast, as it usually includes a pollen count report. Schedule your outdoor activities when these levels are low – typically earlier in the day or after it has rained.

2. Keep windows and doors closed during high-pollen times: To reduce the amount of indoor allergens, keep windows and doors closed during periods when pollen counts are at their highest.

3. Clean air filters and ducts: Keep heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems clean by regularly changing air filters and having ducts cleaned periodically.

4. Use a HEPA air purifier indoors: A High-Efficiency Particulate Air (HEPA) filter is an excellent tool for reducing airborne allergens like pollen inside your home.

5. Vacuum floors regularly with a vacuum that has a HEPA filter to minimize dust mites as well as other allergens from settling on carpets or rugs.

6. Shower before bedtime & change clothing upon entering the house: Remove any accumulated allergens from hair, skin & clothing by bathing prior to going bed each night or immediately after spending extended periods outdoors during allergy season

7- Wash bedding frequently in hot water using mild detergents - this may help remove existing mold spores that have settled into fibers along with killing off pesky dust mite populations residing within pillows/mattresses/linen/etcetera

8) Consider implementing dehumidifiers around key areas throughout household spaces experiencing dampness issues - helping maintain appropriate humidity conditions while also inhibiting growth potential fungal colonies/sources such molds - aim between 30% –50%

9) Nasal saline rinses can be helpful since they wash away impurities taken
